paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision projects are like most Visual Studio .NET language-base projects, such as Visual C#, Visual Basic .NET and Visual J#, but with a flair of Eiffel. Just like those aforementioned languages, EiffelEnvision projects, predominately, ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htmmanage files, and directly reflect and underlying file system. However, there are fundamental differences between EiffelEnvision projects and other language projects, even those that ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htmmanage files.

EiffelEnvision projects, denoted by the ../../../images/icons/project.ico icon in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer, are segregated into four very distinct segments, sectioned beneath the EiffelEnvision project node.
../../../images/icons/references.icoproject.xmlreferencesReferences
../../../images/icons/project_items.icoproject.xmlproject_itemsProject Items
../../../images/icons/eiffel_libraries.icoproject.xmleiffel_librariesEiffel Libraries
../../../images/icons/folder.icoproject.xmlother_filesOther Files Each section is disparate from each other. Only the project.xmlproject_itemsProject Items and project.xmleiffel_librariesEiffel Libraries nodes base any resemblance to one another.

The References of an EiffelEnvision project contains all of the project's component references, added to a project when a project is created using one of the ../adding_projects/projects.xmlEiffelEnvision Project Templates or when explicitly ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskAddingRemovingProjectReferences.htmAdding References. For more information about the References section of an EiffelEnvision project, see references/references_folder.xmlReferences Folder.

Eiffel's principle system of reuse is through source code reuse, unlike the .NET Framework's binary reuse through assemblies. ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET still maintains reuse through source code, as Eiffel does, but also permits binary reuse through assemblies and ../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xmlPrecompiled Libraries. EiffelEnvision supports all of these concepts, but unlike other environments, used in conjunction with Eiffel or Eiffel for .NET, there is no implicit, clean separation is made between project files/source code and reused Eiffel libraries source code. In ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET further separation is required between source code reuse and binary reuse, using assemblies.

EiffelEnvision remedies this integral issue with a very distinct and clean separation between component (assembly) references, project files, where it be a bitmap resource or Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/index.xmlclass source file, and Eiffel source libraries. As aforementioned, EiffelEnvision includes a project.xmlreferencesReferences section for each of it's projects. Contained within this section are all component and ../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xmlPrecompiled Library references for that project. project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items and eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries support the separation of project-specific Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclasses and files and Eiffel library ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclass source files, respectively. Although the separation between project_items/project_items.xmlProject Items and eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries is not strictly enforce by EiffelEnvision, for other tool compatibility reasons, it is recommended that all EiffelEnvision projects adhere to this convention. Clean separation will assist in the future maintenance or adoption of your projects, by other developers. Because Eiffel source files are include using ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclusters, there will be no confusion as to what files are project files and what files are Eiffel library sources.
